Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay!!”
Reviews.Author: jbeans1227
Reviews.Content: What a great stay we had at this location! The staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. The hotel was absolutely spotless, from the lobby to the dining area to the nicely landscaped grounds to our suite. Our two-room suite was the largest we've seen and the decor was pleasant. The linens were premium and we had a very comfortable night. The kids loved the indoor/outdoor pool, and were able to swim outside in March. What a bonus! The evening happy hour had a very large selection of foods, enough that we were able to make a full dinner out of it. The breakfast selection was also quite large, and the staff did a great job of keeping it well stocked. We always seek out Drury locations wherever we travel and as usual, weren't disappointed with this fabulous location! Our one complaint? We only got to spend one night there!

Reviews.Title: “Free Food and Drinks!!”
Reviews.Author: JessG21
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Big Ten Tournament, and whenever the tournament is held in Indy again, I will stay here in the future. The service was great. When we checked in we were informed of the ameneties, my favorite of which was the free food and drinks! I was able to eat my entire dinner at the hotel for free. There was everything from hot dogs and baked potatoes to make your own nacho's with cheese, salsa, and beans. They also had salad, celery, and carrots for the healthy folk. You were allowed 3 alcoholic beverages in the 2 hour window. I had a margarita, a tequila sunrise, and a screwdriver... all for free!!!! The "bartender" was even kind enough to make kiddie cocktails for the kids! There is fountain soda and fresh popped popcorn available almost all day (I think till 10pm). The pool was heated and was half indoor and half outdoor. Even though it was cold you could still swim outside! The breakfast was nice as well, with all of your standard items of eggs, waffles, bagels, juice ect. The room was very clean and comfortable. No complaints from anyone in my family. I am not one to post reviews often, but for this hotel I had to spread the word. I can see why it is #1 in Indianapolis and will look to stay at a Drury Inn in other cities I visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan G
Reviews.Content: We went on a crowded weekend; however, the hotel delivered that Drury quality that we expect. This is a newer hotel and so it looked nice with updated amenities. Great front desk staff, great dining room staff and our doggies were not disappointed either. There is even room off to the side of the hotel to walk them. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MORockwood
Reviews.Content: Drury Inn's always are better than the rest with the free food at dinner, vouchers for free adult beverages, a popcorn machine, and fountain drinks in the evening. This Drury was very new, and the exactly the same as another one in Des Moines I've written about. It has an elegant lobby, nice large open breakfast area with more food than I've seen in a continental breakfast, nice rooms as usual with stone counter tops, large bathrooms, big flat screen tv, and comfortable bed and pillows. (I stayed in a room with two queens). The location is right next to the interstate, but there was hardly any traffic noise. It must be well insulated. The area is nice and safe with some good restaurants around.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice property”
Reviews.Author: Jill-Ohio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Super Bowl week and it was a wonderful experience. From the minute we walked into the door until we left, it felt like we were in a 5-star property. The front desk staff were very welcoming and answered any questions we had. When we arrived in our room, we were so surprised at how nice and spacious it was. Since it was Super Bowl week and there was a lot of activity going on at the hotel, we were afraid it would be noisy, but we never heard anything once the door was closed. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we have already made reservations to stay during the Indy 500!

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway trip”
Reviews.Author: Penny M M
Reviews.Content: We spent 1 night here to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary & was very pleased. We had a lg clean room, the staff was friendly & helpful & we ate supper & had breakfast there also & they both were very good. We enjoyed the hot tub & workout room. You get alot of extra things for your money & it has a great location. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No other place to stay but here.”
Reviews.Author: amac0668
Reviews.Content: I can now see why this hotel is #1 on Trip Advisor. This is a great place with a very friendly and helpful staff that gets my ABCD (Above and Beyond the Call of Duty) vote. Rooms were clean and there was a good selection of food at breakfast and during the 5:30 Kickback. You will not be disappointed staying at this hotel. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: nvky
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, comfy bed, friendly employees--- what more could you ask for!

Reviews.Title: “I can see why they are number 1 in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: firefighter5811
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were met with professionalism! Not to mention friendly! We loved the pool not the biggest but clean and warm plus really fun to swim outside in February! The beds we extremely comfortable!! Rooms were very clean!!!! Breakfast was amazing!!! And the popcorn machine made a pretty tasty treat for my 3 yr old!!! Great location all the restaurants u could imagine all within 2 miles of this amazing establishment! I highly recommend GT south BBQ for dinner!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Bad Food”
Reviews.Author: Lola_Von_Skilet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Inn with our kids. We upgraded to a suite, which worked out perfectly. We were able to visit with friends in the sitting room, while the kids hung out in the bedroom. The indoor-outdoor pool was awesome. It was fun to be able to swim outdoors while it snowed. When we got cold, we would just swam under the wall to swim inside or get in the hot tub. The hotel is clean and the staff is extremely friendly. However, the food choices for breakfast and the kickback hour were quite limited and not very good. Several of the waffle makers did not function correctly and we burned at least three waffles during our stay. However, we did appreciate the fact that they did have sodas and popcorn available until 9:30 PM every night. The location was great. We would stay here, again, the next time we were in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: lbottorff
Reviews.Content: I'm a very picky traveler. However, found this hotel to be extremely clean - especially bathrooms!!!! Beds very comfortable. Only negative comment is that breakfast area was very crowded having trouble finding place to sit. We had four other rooms for a volleyball tourney and all others also were very pleased with hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Beentheredonethat987
Reviews.Content: This place is very cool the pool and the way the wall divides the pool so you can go under the wall is really awesome I would so tell other People to go stayed in 08

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap hotel but watch out for the other guests!”
Reviews.Author: lushou
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to a highway, very clean and the staff was very friendly. The only bad part is that the other guests were out of control. Last night there were 19 people in the indoor pool, 4 people in the outdoor pool and 12 people in the hot tub. There were very few parents around and the kids were out of control. The hotel rules require a parent/guardian to be in the pool area when kids are there, but the rule was not enforced.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't wait to write this review”
Reviews.Author: mamadebbie
Reviews.Content: Came to Indy to visit relatives, although there were closer hotels to their home, we opted for Drury, because we have always had good service with them in other cities. This hotel was spotless! The floors had such a high shine to them, if the sun had been shining it would have blinded us. We missed the Eve meal both nights, but made b'fast last morning, and it was good. Last hour of serving, and it was not crowded, and plenty of food left. Would like to see the free soda all hours instead of a time limit. Staff were all courteous, from the maids and maintenance, to the desk clerks. The desk clerk took the time to print out directions to my relatives house. And managed to greet everyone who came thru the door, and never made me feel rushed or that I was a bother. Both ladies took great care in their appearance, and were extra personable, represented the Hotel superbly. I'm not sure why some have complained of noise of traffic? I am a small town person, and this was just "city noise" Our room was across from a hospital, we heard sirens but they were not distracting. I am also a smoker, and it was nice to acquire a room that allowed it, although I would reccomend Drury think about installing air cleaners like Ionic Breeze in these rooms, would have brought mine from home, if I had thought about it. Never made it to the pool, and wish it was open at all hours, would have been nice to sit in the hot tub. Since there is no lifeguard, not sure why it closes anyway. Planning on more frequent trips to Indy, and this is where we'll stay. And continues our positive experience with the Drury Chain, that is our choice in ANY location.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT THE DRURY FOR OUR FAMILY CHRISTMAS”
Reviews.Author: herbiedoodle
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Drury for our family Christmas get together (30 of us). When I spoke with the manager, Robert Allen, to get our reservations he was great to work with and very accommmodating. We could not have been happier with our stay. The employees went above and beyond to make our stay special. You can tell what kind of management they have as we had stayed there for our Christmas get together last year and many of the same employees were still working there this year. Kudos to the cleaning staff also--property was spotless. Thanks again to the staff at the Drury Inn and Suites Indianapolis Northeast--you do an awesome job!!!

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn - reliable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracywithakid
Reviews.Content: Friendly service. Very clean room. Massive suite with king bed for a reasonable price. Bed was a little soft though.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: werpicky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from Thanksgiving day through the weekend at the recommendation of our daughter who lives in Indy. So glad we did! I am very picky about hotels and this was the best one I've ever stayed in. Our room was immaculate and the bed was as comfortable as our own! The staff was very friendly, the food good, and we were very pleased with the location as it was convenient to all we needed. We'll definitely stay here again and hope to find Drury Hotels wherever we travel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: disgusted41
Reviews.Content: We had a bedroom/living room suite (room 523) the night before Thanksgiving for our family of five and loved it. The living room was large (with sleeper sofa and recliner) and so was the 2-queen bedroom. There was a large mini bar connecting the living area and bedroom with the bathroom off it. The room was immaculate! One of the cleanest rooms we have ever had. While it was directly off the freeway we never heard any noise, however we were facing the opposite direction. The front desk staff was very friendly. Great breakfast, too. However, be aware that the $129 a night room (bargain for the size) held a hefty $22 tax which I was unaware of.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Decent Location”
Reviews.Author: musicguy8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room at the Drury for a nice weekend getaway. The hotel is in a good location, being located right next to the interstate. There are plenty of places to go and eat around the hotel, however you are about 30 minutes from downtown indy if you are wanting to go there. The hotel has an excellent staff which greeted us with a smile upon entering. Check in went smoothly. Went up to our room and found it to be in great shape. The hotel had a great pool and great breakfast. They also have free internet and free soda which makes the stay even that much better. The weekend we were there, was also the same weekend as a hockey and basketball tournament. There were a lot of kids, but the hotel had them under a pretty good wing. The only time I ever noticed they were there was at breakfast and at the pool. Drury definitely has this thing figured out. I have stayed at numerous Drury Inn's and I have never been disappointed with the service that was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for kids and pets”
Reviews.Author: DavidL8
Reviews.Content: Perfect location close to the "loop". The managers and staff are outstanding. The rooms are spotless and so very quiet! We enjoyed the breakfast (especially sausage and biscuits) and the "Kickback" time-three free drinks and a variety of snacks, including salads, baked potatoes, nachos and chicken fingers. Best yet-absolutely no bedbugs!!! Everything was spotless. The hot tub is hot and the pool is cool but not cold. Free parking and you do not pay one penny for a stupid, useless pet fee!! Way to go Drury!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice pet-friendly hotel - loved the Happy Hour & Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pad_lake
Reviews.Content: The drinks / snacks at happy hour, pet friendly atmosphere, excellent staff, and overall clean room make the Drury a good value - despite the higher price. Stayed last year with our dog and couldn't have been happier. The pool and hot tub were great (there's an outdoor "swim under" area that was refreshing in November). The breakfast and happy hour alone make up for the extra price you'll pay to stay. The room was nice but no view really to speak of and was a little loud. It was mostly clean, although we had a water issue by the bathroom door that we never reported, we just kept towels on it to keep it dry. While they may need to do some maintenance in the room(s), the amenities are abound, and you'll have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Luke W
Reviews.Content: We came to Indy for one night with our kids to go the the children's museum, and I must say that this hotel lived up to its rank on Tripadvisor. The rooms were nice, great staff, and the free popcorn, evening food and breakfest buffett were all excellent. I would definitely stay there again. I felt we got a great deal more value than what we paid. Good job!

Reviews.Title: “The staff sets this hotel apart!”
Reviews.Author: coryandcarissa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Drury for two nights to take in the Indy Motor Speedway and the Indy Children's Museum. Was very pleased by the hotel and especially the staff! We had several personal point of contacts with both the Manager and Asst. Mgr. of the hotel who were both exceptional. It is clear that the Drury is #1 in Indy because they work at it! Loved having breakfast in the hotel, as well as enjoyed the evening "kick back" one night as well (did I mention both are free?). Although, if you were to ask my kids, they would have stayed just based on the free popcorn in the lobby. :) My only suggestion for improvement - make the hotel 100% smoke free!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff, clean facilities.”
Reviews.Author: naomiaad
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great price. The evening food is awesome. Didn't even need dinner. The staff was so friendly. Wish we could have stayed longer. Very pet friendly. The room was clean and efficient. Had both a microwave and mini fridge. Will definitely be looking for a Drury Inn on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Hotel, What more can you say?”
Reviews.Author: Charlies1600
Reviews.Content: This is a new hotel and it was great! We usually stay at the other location in Indy which has been around for a long time. But we thought we could try something NEW. This hotel was nice and great staff. They were very helpful. The rooms were up to date and clean. Drury never stops amazing me. I don't know how you can't want to stay there. Free food and drinks in the evening and free hot food for breakfast. I don't mean any of that donuts and coffee crap either. You get a real breakfast. Sausage, eggs, waffles, pancakes, and the list goes on. You still get one hour of free long dist phone call, plus free internet and parking. For the money you really cant go wrong. This is why we have been doing business with Drury for the past 6 years now. I encourage every one to give Drury a chance. Trust me you'll be glad you did. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel meets all your needs”
Reviews.Author: Kytraveltrio
Reviews.Content: The breakfast offers a nice variety. Room was large and clean. Very nice staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Layover Stay in Indy”
Reviews.Author: RansRider
Reviews.Content: On our travels east, we spent one night at this Drury Inn in Indianapolis. This was our second stay at a Drurys property and we feel we get good value for our $$. I would really like to give this hotel a 3.5 rating but TA does not allow that. The room was very clean and the bed was comfy enough for a good nights rest, however, the traffic outside was noticeable so if that sort of thing bothers you, please reconsider this location. In general, we have found Drury Inns well worth the stay. At the desk when we checked in was Trish--very friendly and accommodating! And of course, at Drurys you get the evening cocktail, snacks (really a meal), and at morning a full breakfast all included in the room price. Enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Drury”
Reviews.Author: kycuzn
Reviews.Content: Seems as if Drury Hotel's never let you down. Food and drinks were good, staff was especially friendly and efficient and the rooms, as usual, immaculate. An earlier reviewer noted the highway sounds. We were also facing the highway and the noise was noticeable enough for us to turn on the A/C fan, which pretty much drowned it out. If you want the quieter side of the hotel, ask for an odd numbered room!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST, SKIP THE REST”
Reviews.Author: DoneldaD
Reviews.Content: I have been staying with them every month since June and sometimes twice a month. I have shopped around and you can't beat this Inn. The rooms are spacies, bedding is over the top, bathrooms are large and clean, large TV and you get Breakfast and Dinner included in your price. I just won't stay anywhere else. You won't regret your stay here. The staff is number one. The whole place is clean and friendly and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice---but right on interstate”
Reviews.Author: 1-spidermonkey-1
Reviews.Content: I don't usually ding a hotel for things that it can't control, but I'm going to take a star off for my unusually restless sleep gotten at the Drury. The hotel adjoins I-69 and we were placed in a room that faces the interstate. Most hotels that I stay in aren't as noisy as this one in terms of allowing outside noises into the room. I've stayed in NYC hotels, hotels on the interstate, etc.etc. and I could hear every rambling semi and rumble loud and clear. To make matters worse to the all-night sounds of the interstate coming from the outside, we were across from a room that was having a party with guests coming and going all night until 3:30am. I am not dinging Drury for this because we didn't complain to hotel management (there was no need---there was no way we were sleeping with the roar of the interstate happening), but it simply added to the noise level. The other reason I'm withholding a star is for the KickBack menu --- bland and uninspiring (nice idea, poor execution). Wine doesn't pair well with chili or potato, sorry. Anyways, this Drury is new, clean, and spacious....

Reviews.Title: “Who doesn't love Drury Inns?”
Reviews.Author: SunDiego123
Reviews.Content: We love Drury and this location lived up to Drury's reputation and then some. Nicest check-in ever (thanks Maurietta!) We booked the cheapest room (2 Queens, e-saver rate of $80+) and got so much value for our dollars. The room was spacious and included a fridge, microwave and single serve coffeemaker. The bath was large. The beds were comfy. The internet was reliable and FAST! Our room was very clean and the common areas in the hotel were also clean. The best part about Drury is their free breakfast (scrambled eggs, sausage, bagels, biscuits & gravy, waffle maker, cold cereal, and the list goes on). Oh no, wait... the best part about Drury is their KICKBACK at 5:30. Free drinks (beer, wine, margaritas and more!) and enough appetizers to call it "dinner". Hot dogs, mac-n-cheese, nachos, baked potatoes, salad... This location had a huge dining area. It was like a restaurant! Plenty of seats, plenty of newspapers, good coffee. Just really nice. Thanks Drury! We'll be back next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Clean, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Petroparts
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending the Indiana State Fair, Great Access to the Interstates and the whole city. Breakfast and Dinner Snacks were great, the room was clean, the kids enjoyed the pool, Great clean place to stay, we had 4 kids age 5-15 so the Breakfast and dinner snacks were perfect plus free popcorn all day. Plenty of parking, felt very safe, great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bugdane
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for a short get-a-way. This was our first experience staying in a Drury Inn. We both loved this hotel. The staff was exceptional, everyone was very friendly. The room was very clean. We both loved the free "kick-back" (they called it appetisers, I called it dinner) at 5:30, which consisted of chicken tenders, hot dogs, baked potatoes, mac & cheese, salad, assorted chips, and two drinks for adults. The food was very good. The free breakfast bar contained, eggs, sausage, french toast, waffels, biscuits and gravy and assorted breads and pasteries, and fruit. They also have free popcorn and soda in the evening for the guests. They have an indoor/outdoor pool and an exercise room. Also the hotel was very easy to get to. It sits right off the interstate and there is a traffic light at the end of the hotel drive. If you're going to Indianapolis, this is a wonderful place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great time & we loved it”
Reviews.Author: nursekat
Reviews.Content: the people are great here, my husband is handicapped and all of the staff couldn't have been more helpful. We wil be coming back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Already making plans to come back”
Reviews.Author: Deafviking
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a Drury Inn once before a long time ago and it was a good experience. When I started planning a little mini-vacation to Indy, I saw that there was a Drury Inn and based on my previous experience, decided to book my family here. None of my family ever stayed at one and was skeptical. They thought it was too good to be true type of thing with all the free options After spending two nights here, all my family wants to do now is to make sure we stay at Drury Inn from now on. The hotel was great and always clean. A perfect example: They offer free popcorn in the afternoon. Well, kids will eat it and make a mess (it's hard not to). I would see popcorn on the floor in the hallway when I leave my room and when I get back about 10 minutes later, it's been cleaned up!! The staff was great. I asked several times for confirmation or directions and each time, they would print up the info or directions for me to have. I saw the manager several times thoughout the day, walking around, talking to guest and asking me if everything was good. He acted like he wanted to make sure you were happy there. Never saw that at other chains. Of course, the free breakfast and 5:30 kickback food were excellent. So that took care of our breakfast and dinner. It's a great place for a great value. We're planning to visit family in Decemeber and we're already talking about changing our routes so that we can swing by and stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: YWGJetsTraveller
Reviews.Content: My Dad and I were taking my nephew and daughter to their first ever NASCAR race and Indianapolis was the destination. I started by researching hotels on TripAdvisor and was surprised to find the Drury ranked so high for such a low price. After reading the reviews, it was booked, and as usual, TA was 100% spot on! Check in was a breeze, the room was comfortable, the pool nice and refreshing after a hot day in the sun, and the freebies were very nice indeed. Everyone on TripAdvisor touts the free breakfast, Kickback and Popcorn and Drinks, but the free Long Distance is a nice touch too! I would recommend this property to anyone, and am hoping that Drury will build a hotel in either Grand Forks or Fargo, North Dakota, as it would be full of cross border shoppers from Winnipeg all the time! I will stay in a Drury any chance I get!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bftlspk43
Reviews.Content: Been here before, will stay again. Beds are comfortable, no overwieght duvet to sweat under. Breakfast was tasty, comparable to other chains, the coffee was tastier.

Reviews.Title: “Mrs”
Reviews.Author: Ledger05
Reviews.Content: very clean, friendly desk help. Clean and spacious room. Love all the free perks with this chain. Whenever we are travelling this will be our hotel of choice from now on. Just wish there were more throughout the US.

Reviews.Title: “Drury Inn saved our son's teddy bear”
Reviews.Author: MichaelG95
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Drury Inn on July 12-16, 2011. The 1-bedroom suite was perfect for us, with a separate bedroom for the parents. The room and the common areas were clean. Our kids had a great time in the indoor-outdoor pool (which is fairly small). Breakfast was only average for this type of hotel. But the staff were exceptionally helpful, as shown by the efforts they made when we left our son's teddy bear behind (wrapped up in the sheets of his rollaway bed). We didn't realize until that evening when we had driven home. We called and yes, the housekeeper had found the bear, had sent it to the front desk, who mailed it to us the next day. A great effort by the staff and much, much appreciated by us!

Reviews.Title: “A very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KYtravelman39604
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this hotel on my way to Muncie, IN to visit family. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, the amenities and the size of the room. The had a good assortment of food/drinks during the evening happy hour. I was actually able to make a meal out of it and did not have to leave the hotel for dinner. I'm sure if you stayed more than a couple of nights, you would probably get tired of the food, but for one night, it was great. I was also impressed with how large the room was. The large flat-screen tv was a nice feature. I stayed in a jacuzzi room. It was one of the largest hotel bathrooms I've seen and was very clean. The hotel is conveniently located off I-69 but it was a bit difficult to find the entrance drive because I couldn't make a left-hand turn. I had to go to the next street and turn around to enter the holel. That was a minor inconenience to an otherwise great hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: lanielyd
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room as we were on the road and when we got to the hotel, the manager explained that the hotel was overbooked and offered a smoking room. I wasn't thrilled, but we were so tired from traveling and he offered to take me to it to see what I thought of it. Not a trace of smoke smell. The room was an upgrade and very nice. But I was more impressed with the way it was handled than anything else. Breakfast was very good--typical eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, yogurt, cereal, etc. Location was nice, too----right off the interstate---easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Best Drury Inn Ever”
Reviews.Author: HSC2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is great - clean, pet-friendly rooms at a really good price. But this hotel was pristine, and it had an ultra-professional staff and excellent room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sgoes
Reviews.Content: We made a 3-day trip to Indy with three other couples. Like other Drury Inns, this one had a terrific breakfast and evening happy hour. There was even more substantial food than we've had at other Drury's. We arrived on a Saturday and the hotel was packed with lots of young baseball players in town for a tournament. We were concerned about the crowd and possible noise but it was not an issue at all (and we were on four separate floors.) Service was wonderful and all of the staff were friendly and very helpful with directions to specific locations in the area. We'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the Indianapolis area.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe a place can give so many freebies!”
Reviews.Author: Kaysiah-chan
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best place I've stayed at in the US. It's too bad Drury (did not hear about it till I needed to book a place to stay in Indiana) is not established yet in the Northeast and Northwest (I think they're in 20 something states?). So the freebies: 1) I called a day ahead regarding an early check-in and luckily (since I called ahead) they were able to prepare a room for us at 9:30AM (normal check-in time is 3PM). When I checked out and reviewed the bill, I saw they did not charge me for the early check-in! Most places I know would charge you a percentage or half the charge of the daily rate for an early check-in or late check-out. 2) Free breakfast. This includes: scrambled eggs where you can sprinkle cheese & cut up ham on them, toast, bagels (along with butter, jelly, & cream cheese), mini donuts, muffins, waffle maker to make fresh waffles, fruit, boiled egg, yogurt, sausage, biscuits & gravy to go with them, juice, coffee, and I might actually be forgetting something but it's a lot of good food to choose from. 3) Free popcorn & drinks (soda) from an old fashioned popper in the dining area available in the afternoons to early evenings (I can't remember the exact times). 4) Free "Kickback" 5:30-7PM which includes snacks like chips, pretzels, chicken fingers, hot dogs, etc. 5) Free Alcohol. We were given a card when we arrived allowing us to receive 3 alcoholic drinks per day per person. This can be picked up during the "Kickback" time. The had wine, cocktails, and beer. 6) Free Long Distance calls. Although there was no need to use this, I was still amazed. 7) Free Wireless Internet. 8) Check-out. The normal check-out time is 11AM, but on the bill it says if you need an extra hour to prepare to leave, just let them know and they won't charge for it. The customer service was very helpful, especially regarding our early check-in. Maurietta (not sure if I spelled it right, if it's wrong I'm sorry) was especially friendly and helpful regarding this. The room was clean. I wasn't used to the smell (from NJ, so Indiana could of course in general could smell different to me) but it was neither a good or bad smell. The bed and pillows were comfy. We were exhausted both days and had no problem falling asleep. We did not try out the pool but it looks like (from what I saw) that the pool is half inside and half outside. We did not try the room service either so I can't comment about that. This place is around 45 minutes from Indiana International Airport. We rented a car and drove here no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not A Problem Here”
Reviews.Author: TrevorPresley
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with friendly staff, great rooms and all available ameneties that you will ever need. From the moment that you check in to the moment that you leave you are felt welcome and just at home. The staff cannot do enough for you.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome way to start our family cross country vacation.”
Reviews.Author: calgrlzl
Reviews.Content: We had never stayed at this chain of hotel before, but were pleasantly surprised. It was not only decorated beautifully, but extremely clean. My family liked it so well that during our cross country vacation, we changed some of our reservations to stay where one of these hotels were available.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with super staff”
Reviews.Author: HScottTally
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families; the rooms and amenities are great. The staff is wonderful and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful rooms, great decor, reasonable rates & decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sharingthoughts_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great value for the price. Very clean and high end decor both in the lobby and the rooms. Generous space in the room and comfortable beds. The bathroom also was fairly large. We had a cot brought in and still felt spacious. Large flat screen TV, mini fridge & microwave. Service was great. The free breakfast was good, we missed the free evening snack but will try next time I stay at a Drury hotel. I would recommend any Drury hotel after this experience. Free wifi was easy no password needed, snacks in lobby at all times, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: kelbro1960
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I really liked this place. Good value, spacious room, very friendly staff. The free breakfast and evening happy hour food is plentiful, but there are no healthy options if you like to eat that way. There is a microwave and fridge in the room and a Trader Joe's nearly. Free wireless in the room, I used the guest self-laundry which worked well. Popcorn is available 24 hours a day. The pool is there, but it is very small, but we did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this is great!”
Reviews.Author: pilotmom90
Reviews.Content: My friend and I met in Indianapolis for a girls' getaway. I selected this Drury based on its e-rates and its reviews on Tripadvisor. I was not disappointed! Everything is shiny clean and we were given excellent service in every way. The location is great and it's easy to get to great shopping and dining. I thought that Drurys are pet-friendly, but figured this one must be an exception. It's cleanliness is top-notch and spotless. I was surprised, therefore, to be greeted this morning by two adorable small dogs in the hallway. You would never have known there were pets in the vicinity. The previous reviews are exactly right about the free 5:30 kickback reception. The food was fresh and delicious, with a good variety. Items were kept well-stocked and we did not bother to go out for supper since the kickback was so generous. Amy at the front desk was very accommodating and helpful. She handled our special requests with no problem and made us feel very welcome. Ebony was also smiling everytime I saw her and she went out of her way to be cheerful with each guest. I called my husband and told him I'm eager for us to come back to this Drury for a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another great Drury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: wildbirdkalamazoo
Reviews.Content: Let me say at the get go my wife and I are Drury fans. Drury understands that our fur friends are in fact family. This hotel was not exceptional in that it isn't much different than other Drurys and that's exactly why my wife and I stay at Drurys as frequently as we do. Extremely clean, great staff, great munchies at night and a nice breakfast. This hotel was FULL, Who knew they play play basketball in Indy. The hotel was a very pleasant stay. It was quiet and clean, you only knew it was full from the parking lot. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need is here”
Reviews.Author: spgurt
Reviews.Content: We just got home yesterday from staying here and it was a very enjoyable trip. The only downside ( for me) was that is was so close to the freeway. But other than that it was a nice place to stay. You have everything around you, Castleton Mall is less than a mile away. Plenty of restaurants, too. Our favorite was Stir Crazy. The happy hour at 5:30 is great too. That first night it was nice not have to rush out for something to eat when they had drinks and a good selection of food. Breakfast was good. It saved my family about $40 a day. Even though the place was full from spring break travelers, it was clean and the staff was so nice and friendly. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value - love it!”
Reviews.Author: thazard143
Reviews.Content: We love Drury Inn and look for them whenever we travel. It is great for families. Starting with the 5:30 kickback -complimentary appetizers and drinks. Free long distance - great for the kids to make a quick call to Grandma and Grandpa to tell them about the day. The free breakfast. The room itself was ok - the decor seemed outdated but clean. We were near the end of the hall and noise was an issue. We heard the neighbors tv and kids running through the hall and every room door shut. The staff was amazingly friendly - super nice. The pool was a bit chilly because it flowed into an outdoor pool. Will continue to stay where Drury Inns are - wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Too many small kids”
Reviews.Author: eold2412
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3-24-2011 for one night. I will first say the front desk was very friendly and efficient with a quick check in. The evening food and complimentary drinks were very good with a nice selection. This was the first time i took advantage of the food. The problem encountered here was the small kids taking up tables, dropping food, drinks and running around, and a less than friendly Amanda making the cocktails. It may have been because of the long lines and kids who knows as they were certainly getting to me. Then i thought i would relax in the hot tub for a while. Didn't happen as when i went down to the pool area there were kids everywhere. Not just a few but many. The very oversized hot tub was so full of wild unsupervised small kids i did not have room to get in nor would i have wanted to. I cannot for the life of me figure where all of the small kids came from as i have been to many hotels over the years in tourist destinations that never had that many kids. I was beginning to think that they came to take advantage of the free amenities. It may have been a fluke as the hotel itself was very nice but i am not sure i could ever go back picturing all of the kids there.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Ohio_Tom_11
Reviews.Content: We were taking a vacation to Indiana, and the first destination was Indianapolis. We were looking for a hotel to book as we were about to leave, and found this one, and it looked nice. Upon arrival, the reservations had not come in at, but that was our fault since we had booked only hours before. The front desk was very friendly and cooperative, and got us a room. I usually do not sleep well in hotels, but I slept very soundly, and I was actually surprised. About the only disturbance would be sirens of ambulances going to the hospital across the street. The room was very nice, and the wi-fi was great. The breakfast was delicious, and there was a lot of variety. We returned that afternoon to find a free afternoon "snack." They had fountain drinks and good food. The pool was also great. We were very pleased with our stay, and were very surprised at how much the hotel had to offer for how low the rate was.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: dedepo
Reviews.Content: We (husband and I) spent a night here on an overnight trip to Indy. I chose this hotel for it's great reviews here and luckily it happened to be in the part of town we needed. We had a great experience and would definitely stay here again. The staff was very friendly, rooms were clean, and the amenities were great. You won't be sorry if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: docious1
Reviews.Content: With free parking, free internet, free breakfast and free snack hour this hotel is a great value. when compared to other hotels in a similar price range. The location was minutes from shopping and restaurants. The room and bathroom was very clean and large. The 5:30 kickback hour was great for a snack. They had a variety of food to choose from and lots of families were taking advantage of the free meal. The breakfast was one of the best I've seen from any hotel with waffles, french toast, sausage and biscuits, eggs and the usual continental fare. The hotel staff was very welcoming and courtesy. They even came around during the kickback hour to clear your plates. The only negative was the room decor is a bit dated looking for being a newer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, great rooms, a lot to offer for FREE”
Reviews.Author: Pezman2005
Reviews.Content: Previously stayed at 8181 Shadeland at the Hilton Indianapolis North directly across the street. Bad experience - would never stay @ that Hilton again... HIGHLY recommend this place though! Great lobby, beautiful interior - friendly staff. Redesigned rooms - free internet - free breakfast - free hot drinks and meals in the evening - and even free popcorn! w00t!!! Definitely a plus and the rate was $83.95 e-Saver vs. Hilton @ $150/night + internet. plus no free food, drinks, etc. Oh also has a microwave and fridge in the room - Hilton did not.

Reviews.Title: “Always beats our expectations”
Reviews.Author: xraysdoc1
Reviews.Content: We moved out of Indy over the past summer, and when we return to visit friends, this is where we stay. The 2 room suite has a wonderful layout. The rooms are separated by the bathroom and a short hallway, so unlike most 2 room setups, you can watch tv in the living room when the kids have fallen asleep. The indoor outdoor pool is always a hit with the kids, and when we visited, there was actually a couple inches of snow, so the kids had snowball fights while playing in the pool. Will come back whenever we visit.

Reviews.Title: “All we could have asked for”
Reviews.Author: Bradleydme
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my wife and 2 daughters we were welcomed by an enthusiastic front desk with great courtesy. Quickly getting us into our room a crib and roll away bed were brought up almost instantly! They did charge extra for this which kind of took us by surprise and were not informed up front. Room was immaculate and large. We didnt notice any noise from outside nearby freeway nor hallway all night or morning. Our family is vegan so its tough to rate breakfast, but it was free and there was enough fruit, breads, and cereal to get us a start on the day. What I did see of the other food seemed well presented hot, not greasy looking, clean, and everyone employed there was so nice! We will certainly make this our #1 choice when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Class”
Reviews.Author: mlsrar
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Drury property since I was around 9 years old, at the old Stapleton airport in Denver when we had a flight cancelled. So, it's been a few, ahem, decades. Obviously, there had been some great reviews of this property before, and I had stayed across the street at the Hilton earlier in the year. In comparison with other hotels in the area, including Staybridge, Embassy Suites, and the Hilton, this property completely outdoes them all. Check-in was quick, and the hosts were extremely friendly. We reserved a suite, so we could have some additional privacy and allow our restless toddler the opportunity to get some sleep (he is a light-sleeper). The suites are ~30% larger than Embassy Suites rooms, and have a full-size couch, as well as a recliner, and 37" flat-screens with HD channels. The hallway separating the bedroom was 12' long, with a nice sink and countertop where the fridge and microwave was tucked away. The beds were comfortable and there was a variety of pillow firmness. At 5:30, we decided to check out their iteration of a manager's reception with the 'kickback'. It was great, with a nice selection of hot foods, a potato bar, egg rolls, and some fruit/veggies and what looked to be a bagged salad poured into a nice buffet holder. In addition, popcorn is available all day, as well as a soda-station; both are open until 10 PM, so you can get free snacks/soda until then. The pool is indoor/outdoor; understanding this, in the wintertime, the indoor section would be considered small. The hot tub was nicely sized, the exercise room was relatively small, with 3 ellipticals, and 2 treadmills. The business center had 2 PCs and a free print/scanner hooked up to both machines. Wifi was free and fast throughout the property. In the morning, the breakfast had scrambled eggs, sausages and bacon, biscuits/gravy, french toast, a waffle station, and cereal bar. There were pastries and yogurt as well, though not much in the way of fruit. Overall, it was a FANTASTIC stay, and a great value, inasmuch as you can feed kids and yourselves at the kickback substantially, and spread out in large rooms and enjoy friendly service. My parents were with us and had reserved a king room which faced I-69; they did say there was some road noise, but it was relatively isolated.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Stasia74
Reviews.Content: Let's just say dont ever book thru hotels.com if youre staying here. We reserved a two room suite...only to find out that they don't deal with hotels.com very well. After finding out our suite wasn't available, we were sent to a regular room. Not a huge deal, but not what we ordered. Had to call hotels.com...$100 voucher (still unacceptable). Anyway...the hotel is nice. Room was clean. However, the pool area leaves a lot to be desired. At 9 pm at night, hot tub full of screaming kids. No management in sight. In california and Nevada, children under 12 aren't allowed in hottubs for heath issues. Obviously not in Indiana. Kids were unsupervised, which I understand isnt the hotels issue, but the sign clearly states no children unsupervised. The drink and snack thing was cool. Very loud on a saturday night and packed. We opted to go to P.F. Changs instead. Fabulous. Breakfast was ok for a free breakfast. Eggs, sausage, biscuits and gravy, waffles. Was very good. Management needs to step it up a little at this place. The pool area needs to be regulated better or else there will be injuries or a lawsuit with children. And if they don't work with hotels.com better there will be nothing but unrest.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect family stay!”
Reviews.Author: mmlovers90
Reviews.Content: We really love the Drury Suites hotel chain but this one exceeded our expectations! The staff was the most helpful and friendly I have ever met! Sometimes you will meet someone that is nice or does over and above the call of duty. In this hotel, however, it seemed like every single employee fit that description! This was a great place to stay from the free wifi which worked wonderfully, free hot breakfast (get there early, it fills up quickly, especially if you want to make waffles), free evening hors d'oeuvres, free soda and popcorn in the lobby, the wonderful indoor/outdoor swimming pool, and the fact that pets stay free! This hotel doesn't really have anything within walking distance if that is a concern although we did walk to the Golden Corral restaurant for dinner but it was a bit of a hike (especially once you stuff yourself, LOL!). A great place to stay and we will definitely be coming back again!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for the price in Indianapolis!!!! food was great, service was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: God4Life
Reviews.Content: The hotel was super amazing! from when I walked in the front door, I was greeted by Ebony. She was super amazing!! Ebony made me feel like I was home! upon leaving, Trish was amazing!! super nice!! The housekeepers were amazing too!!!! They are some sweet woman! I really enjoyed my stay here, and would recommend this hotel to all my friends and family! Thanks again, Ebony, Trish, and housekeepers for my amazing stay!!

Reviews.Title: “great service!”
Reviews.Author: familytravlerchicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for it's location. I was surprised how spacious the room was. The KickBack hour was just what we needed after a long drive. we enjoyed the cocktails and finger foods. We checked out the next morning after enjoying a great breakfast. After arriving home my husband realized that he had left some important gear in the drawer at the bedside table. He called the hotel and spoke with Max asst. manager. Max mailed his gear back to him in a few days. Everything was in perfect condition. NOW that's great customer service!! k

Reviews.Title: “great one-night stop”
Reviews.Author: bwsmoney
Reviews.Content: Needed an overnight stop while traveling from PA to IA ... this fit the bill perfectly! Second Drury we've been to, and both have been great. Great staff, top notch rooms (comfy bed, solid materials, very large, quiet, and spotless), nice amenities, and free hot breakfast buffet, all for under $100.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you are going to the Verizon Wireless Music Theater”
Reviews.Author: ktyg
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Drury Inn & Suites in NE Indy while I was in town for the Dave Matthews Band concerts. I had come to Indianapolis for these shows before and stayed elsewhere, but this year that hotel was booked to capacity so I had to find somewhere new. And I am so glad I did! The Drury hotel was about 10 miles off the freeway from the amphitheater's exit, so it was an easy drive to and from the concerts. We couldn't have gotten lost if we would have tried. Our room was comfortable, although a bit noisy since we faced the highway. However, nothing that we couldn't sleep through. (The thunderstorms were another story.) The complimentary drinks, dinner snacks, and breakfast were a wonderful addition to our stay. Since technically tailgating is not allowed at the venue, we had a few cocktails in the hotel lounge prior to departing for the show. It was our bartender's birthday on the day we stayed and she was in great spirits and is clearly a favorite with both the staff and guests. And since we had arrived into town a little later than expected, we were able to skip going out to dinner on that night and just enjoyed the chili-dogs and baked potatoes that were available to guests. This was a great hotel with many ammenities; a real bargain at less than $100/night. I will definitely stay at a Drury hotel again when I travel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel with lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: Alma N
Reviews.Content: This place is brand new. The customer service is outstanding. They have free breakfast which was fantastic. This was a full meal with OJ, eggs and even waffles. The rooms are impeccable and they have a free happy hour with appetizers that is also a great freebie. The price was a bargain for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Where comfort meets incredible value”
Reviews.Author: carolynFortWayne_IN
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a one-night holiday over the July 4th weekend. We couldn't have beem more pleased. Got an e-saver rate for an oversized room but was automatically upgraded to a one-bedroom suite at check-in, much to our surprise. Check-in was efficient with the manager pitching in to ensure that there was no wait. Everyone is so friendly! The hotel is immaculate and attractive! The suite had one room with two extremely comfortable recliners and a 37" LCD TV, a large bathroom; and a comfy king bedroom with another LCD TV. The bed was super comfortable and I loved all the very lush pillows/ At the 5:50 kickback, we had what served as a free dinner with salad, baked potatoes, chili, chips and hot dogs, plus three free drinks. In the evening there was popcorn and free beverages. We really enjoyed the indoor/outdoor pool. Although the hotel was crowded, there was plenty of room to enjoy the sun and the pool - and we went back in the morning as well to enjoy the spa. The breakfast was also nice with so many choices of french toast, waffles, eggs, sausage and more. Really, this hotel was the best value of any out there. Why pay more and why pay for parking and expensive meals when you can get it all here? While there, we learned that this chain is family owned and that is one reason why they can pay such attention to detail. With everything I mentioned - and an upgrade to a suite - and to think our rate was only $79 plus tax - that is an incredible value which really means a lot today!!! Thank you Drury Inn...see you again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and New”
Reviews.Author: sweetmama1
Reviews.Content: We were in Indianapolis to visit family and friends and decided to try drury's new hotel in Castleton. We have stayed at the drurys in Marion, Il and was very happy. The Hotel was very nice and very clean except when childen would come down for popcorn and spill it all over the floor. Our room was lovely except we had to have the blankets changed!!!!!!! We always take a black light with us to check for dirty linens and it paid off. The staff took care of the problem right away. Thank you very much.... All and all we will be staying there again but I will have my black light in hand!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The stay here was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Rhonna
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled with a baseball team and stayed in this hotel. I can not say enough good things about this hotel and how it is managed. The staff was so incredibly friendly and really catered and cared about your needs. The FREE happy hour and food every evening and the more than sufficient breakfast every morning was a definite plus. Ebony (at the desk) and Desiree (the awesome bartender) were so enjoyable to deal with. We really had a great time with the staff and they seemed to enjoy our group as well. In addition, the hotel was very clean and comfortable. I have told everyone what a great deal the Drury Inn is and if they attend any other tournaments in Indianapolis - THIS is the place to stay. Great job to the manager (who looks like Dr. Green from ER! LOL!)

Reviews.Title: “Car Broken into in parking lot”
Reviews.Author: signinsareapain
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. Nice rooms. Clean and reasonably priced. If you are a light sleeper - there is a bit of street noise. Main concern - Mine and another person’s car were broken into (rear windows smashed in) in the middle of the night. Both cars were parked in front of the hotel. The suspects took a bag full of paperwork (meaningless to them but valuable to me) from my car and two laptops from the other person’s car. No one, form the hotel, offered to pay my $200 deductable (for the repairs). The receptionist said that this had not happened since Xmas... Very comforting.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious and comfy”
Reviews.Author: smittyohio
Reviews.Content: We headed to Indy for a date night. Our room was an oversized king room. There was a separate sitting room with two plush recliners and a large flat-screened TV. It was very comfy and nice not to have to prop up pillows on the bed just to watch TV. The bed itself was very comfortable - plenty of pillows. I was concerned about ambient traffic noise, but didn't find that it kept me awake at all. And I couldn't hear other guests at all! Our room was very clean. The hot breakfast was a nice plus, in addition to free soft drinks and popcorn on Friday night. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Average Drury Inn with plenty of road noise”
Reviews.Author: RazorB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the Final Four festivities. The first night raced downtown after check-in and then a late evening back to the hotel. We discovered overnight that the road noise on our side/end of the hotel facing the highway was very loud. The next day at around 11:30 am (Easter) went down to the front desk and waited for the large front desk lady to pause from complaining to someone in the back about having to work on Easter, and politely requested a new room away from the highway if possible. She said the hotel was pretty full and she doubted it, but also that she wouldn't know until later that day anyway, so come back later.....with-out checking a computer or anything. (again, it was close to noon when I asked) Could be I was not the first to complain about that, but it would have been nice if she would have checked something, or told me she had just looked and there were no rooms available or something. Anything other than just "come back later". I guess I was stopping her from complaining about her life and job, so just get the hell out of here so I can continue seemed to be the theme. That kind of set the tone for the weekend. The lady assisting at night was very nice and seemed totally customer friendly, but the overall attitude of the staff was kind of like the hotel experience in general.... mixed and just ok. Room was decent and clean, but road noise was bad. Fan for A/C was loud too, not sure which was worse. Overall it seemed like a decent clean hotel, but free breakfast was just average, and due to the a.m. desk staff and loud road noise would find someplace else to stay. I like Drury Hotels and use the ones in St. Louis frequently, but this one did not measure up.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Indy”
Reviews.Author: smokeyjsbbq
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a weekend away and decided to stay in this Drury hotel, as we try to always stay in Drurys. This was our 1st stay here and we will for sure be back, the staff was super nice. The rooms were really clean and spacious, we had a hot tub room and it was awesome. I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “I paid $76, including tax and they could...”
Reviews.Author: lsg424
Reviews.Content: I paid $76, including tax and they could easily charge $100 or more. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: cca44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for a quick weekend trip and have a new favorite hotel chain. Everything about this Drury Inn and Suites was fantastic. From the smiling desk clerk who greeted us upon our arrival, until our checkout, everything was perfect. We booked an oversized king room, and expecting just a larger hotel room, we were thrilled to find a room with separate sitting area, 2 TV's, refrigerator and microwave. The bathroom was exceptionally clean and the king size bed was comfortable. The best part of the stay was the e-saver rate that makes this hotel a real bargain. Less than 15 minutes from downtown, this is a great place to stay. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “How about the basics?”
Reviews.Author: Lolenzek
Reviews.Content: Their slogan is "extras are not extra". However there were problems with the basics. For example the heater went on and off all night making it harder to sleep. Cleanliness could have been better, I found a strange hair on out sheets. There were no free cocktails as advertised , I did stay on the night of January 1st, but I should have been told there would be no alcohol served. There was alot of road noise as hotel is next to the x-way. Lastly, the remote wouldn't work unless you were up and 3 feet from the T.V. On the plus side all of the employees were super nice and the hotel was basically clean. The hot breakfast was great and evening snacks were good. The pool was freezing cold but that's expected in January. Location was good for quick access to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Drury”
Reviews.Author: monkeytoz
Reviews.Content: We always look for Drury Inn and Suites wherever we travel. This particular one was about 20 minutes from downtown Indianapolis, but well worth the drive. The person at the front desk, Ebony, was very welcoming and helpful. The room was comfortable and the breakfast was good too. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lillyllu
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms for our stay. The King Suite was spacious, and easy to have privacy, or entertain in the living area. The Handicapped suite was also spacious, with easy access to shelving, and safety in the bath. The regular, 2 queen room was clean, and comfortable. All rooms were very quiet. The lobby was welcoming, and the breakfast was more than a continental style. I will stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Drury exceeded expectations for service and amenities”
Reviews.Author: Lafemmegiselle
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews on Tripadvisor for Indianapolis properties, I focussed on this Drury Inn property and its overall rating. The price, of course, made me willing to gamble so we booked this for an overnight stay. My initial hesitancy was that the brand was foreign to me. But from the moment we entered to check in until the time we left I was checking off the mental list: passed, passed, passed. Each person we encountered no matter what "position" was helpful and made sure to greet us and ask how everything was doing. Of note, the front desk clerk, Sissy, put smiles on our faces when we first arrived and again at checkout. Sissy has the personality that will take her far. The rooms were as nice as expected given the other reviews we had read, and the beds were comfortable as well. Neat and clean and without unnecessary amenities that are wasteful. The indoor/outdoor pool was a plus -- although it was too short for my husband to do laps. But still it is nice to have the option of a dip if desired, despite the season. A unique twist was having an evening "social" that could include families. We opted out of the drink tickets, but when we returned around 9PM we still had the opportunity to grab some popcorn as a fun nightcap on the way to the room. Small things like this can make the difference between a room and a home away from home. And without the additional fees some chains ask for parking and expecially internet this is a must-try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around...except for 1 little problem that ruined the stay.”
Reviews.Author: Lakemanitou
Reviews.Content: As a newer hotel that's close to the corporate offices of a business I visit regularly, I was excited to stay here for the first time last month. The hotel gets very high marks for staff enthusiasm, courtesy, friendlieness, and helpfulness. Being a newer hotel, it was spotlessly clean. I liked the breakfast area, although it did get a bit noisy when the "rush" hit about 8:00 a.m. on a Saturday morning. The room was similarly clean and comfortable. The wireless internet connection (free) was useful. I also liked their simply-put, straight-forward internet privacy policy ("You have no expectation of privacy...). No beating around the bush there--wish others would spare us the jibberish and just come out and say what is obvious: on an unsecured, free wireless internet network connection, you don't have any privacy! There was just one problem, and I discovered later that a colleague who has stayed here twice experienced both times on this visit. I did not get my wake-up call, which made me late for a meeting. That is unaccetable, especially when I asked the front desk about the reliability of their wake-up calls. My back-up system for awakening (the hotel's very cheap alarm clocks) proved equally inadequate. The alarm did go off, but was so quiet that it couldn't be heard and didn't do the job. I'm not that heavy of a sleeper, either! It may be a little problem to some, but it's enough to put them on my "one more chance" list. I'd like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay, will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: scvscot
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great rooms, very clean, quiet, friendly and helpful staff. Only 2 things that could have been better. First, I understand using plastic forks and spoons for breakfast, but do you have to use the cheapest ones on the market? there are lots of nice, strong disposable utensils out there. This was a damper on an otherwise fantastic breakfast. The second was the soap and shampoo, it seemed like it was very dated. I travel a lot and there are a lot of hotels who partner with suppliers such as Bed Bath and Body Works to supply a great experience, with lotions, and mouthwash, etc. Drury seems like they have the same supply they offered in 1971. These are very minor things when you compare them to the overall great experience. Stay there, you will not regret it, but I hope they change these 2 small issues before I return next year. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel clearly understands competition in the current economy!”
Reviews.Author: noyuckyroomsplease
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay! I was attending a family funeral, and could not have been much more comfortable at a Ritz Carlton. The staff was so gracious, and the room was spotless. I loved that there were two rooms with a door. My only, tiny complaint would be that the smoke alarm has a bright light that blinked all night right above the bed. (Good for safety, but sleep, not so much.) I wish I could transfer this hotel to one of my family's regular vacation spots!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: motorcity70
Reviews.Content: Everything in this Drury is PERFECT AND they accept pets! Got a $54 deal through a RoomSaver magazine and was blown away by the quality of the room, service...everything was perfect. They just couldn't have done any better.

Reviews.Title: “Never Been Disappointed with a Drury Experience”
Reviews.Author: karnlowe
Reviews.Content: This is only the second Drury Inn hotel (other was in Louisville), but you feel like you are paying a lot more money that what you actually are for a bathroom with marble floors, the evening coctail hours for little or no cost, the luxurious looking front desk area and the amply spacious rooms. Everything IS spotless as mentioned in other reviews of this hotel. It is like new and kept up quite nicely. We stayed here on our way home to Oklahoma as a quick stopover. VERY NICE FITNESS CENTER area. P.S. - This is the only hotel I have EVER given all 5 stars on all ratings.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Drury Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: jpete02
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night passing through Indianapolis on my way to Southern Indiana. This was the second time I have stayed at a Drury Hotel and I was not disappointed. As is typical for most Drury Hotels, this is a large hi-rise hotel located conveniently to the freeway. Even though this hotel is at the junction of I-69 and I-465, it is easy to access either freeway in any direction. The room was very clean with a large flatscreen tv, big bathroom, and thermostat controlled a/c/heater unit. Free long distance calls, manager's reception during the evening, and hot breakfast in the morning were all much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: familytravelsreno
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, hotel extremely clean, staff very friendly and ready to please, loved the breakfast area and breakfast, providing snacks in the evening was really nice, we really couldn't have asked for anything more. The hotel manager on our last day stopped by our table at breakfast to ask us how are stay was, my husband has traveled to many hotels on business an he said he has never seen that. Elevators were very quick.The only thing I think it misses is maybe a bar/restaurant. It was just a great stay! We would absolutely stay again. We wish that all hotels cared as much for our business!

Reviews.Title: “Overall an Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BritYank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drury Northeast for one night of a three night booking 04/17/09. The hotel is new and beautiful. Rooms are comfortable with everything you need. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. Free evening beverages and snacks – always a plus. Nice indoor/outdoor pool and whirlpool. Staff for the most part, friendly and efficient. Value for money - outstanding. In fact, I cannot say enough nice things about the hotel itself. What could possibly be missing from this vision of perfection? The decidedly cool welcome I received when checking in at the front desk. This perception is undoubtedly biased as I compared it to the welcome we received (travelling with a pet) at the Drury on N. Michigan Road. In all fairness, the receptionist was not rude or inefficient but the difference between my first impression here, and my first impression at the other facility was like night and day. My first instinct was to turn around and walk out, while at the other facility I wanted to check in for a week instead of the three days we stayed there. I would definitely stay at this hotel again if not travelling with a pet. However, with a dog in tow, I highly recommend the other Drury or the Hotel Indigo in Fishers.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadIllinois
Reviews.Content: I was a guest in your hotel for 2 weeks, while working in Indianapolis. I cannot say enough about how much I appreciate the hospitality. Great staff, service, clean room, breakfast and evening beverage service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: nascarfan19
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at Drury Inn just last week and it was a perfect fit for our family. They had friendly service, snacks available for us during the afternoon hours, a great breakfast, and a great fitness room and pool. I would recommend this hotel for anybody, and would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ic_chic
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place to stay. The hotel staff was fantastic, very attentive and extremely friendly. The room was huge, very comfortable and quite. The décor and layout was perfect. The location was close to the highway, easy to get in and out of. Very pet friendly. We travel with our dog Jake and the staff were just as great with him as they were with us. When traveling through Indy, we will be staying here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Drury Inn & Suites Indianapolis Northeast
HotelInfo.Address: 8180 N Shadeland Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46250
